conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a absurdism movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
I'd highly recommend "Gentlemen Broncos" for a delightful blend of absurdity and humor, especially if you enjoy films with a touch of satire. In this movie, a young writer gets his idea stolen by an established novelist at a fantasy writers' convention – it's a fun and quirky take on the world of literature!

Another option could be "The Shadows," which pairs horror with a dash of absurdism as a successful horror author finds himself entangled in a dangerous affair with a mysterious man. This one might appeal to fans of suspenseful, offbeat stories. Enjoy your movie time!

conversation.speaker: USER

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I'd highly recommend "What If..." for its charming exploration of fate and destiny, set under an Athenian night sky. It stars Kristy Swanson and John Ratzenberger. Another intriguing choice is "The Wrestler" featuring Mickey Rourke and Marisa Tomei, a story about standing up for what's right against the odds in the world of professional wrestling. Both movies offer unique perspectives that align with your preference for absurdism. Enjoy!

This film is a powerful exploration of a troubled veteran who works as a taxi driver in New York City. Alternatively, "The Wrestler" with Mickey Rourke in the lead role offers an intimate look at the life of an aging wrestler trying to make a comeback. Both movies are compelling and have garnered much acclaim. Enjoy your movie time!

Another movie you might enjoy is "Jumper" (2008), featuring Hayden Christensen and Kristen Stewart. It's about a young man with teleportation abilities who finds himself caught up in an ancient war between those like him and their enemies.

It's a gripping courtroom drama with a star-studded cast including Tom Cruise, Jack Nicholson, and Demi Moore. The story revolves around military law and uncovers secrets that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

If you're in the mood for something more contemporary and quirky, "Safety Not Guaranteed" is another great choice. This film follows a group of journalists who investigate a man who placed a classified ad seeking a companion for time travel, resulting in an unexpected and heartwarming journey. Enjoy!
